locutie.beschrijving: The sermon describes the finality of judgment, the danger of spiritual hardening (the 'exhaustion' of mercy), and the reality of the Great White Throne judgment.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: Narrative and illustrative. The preacher uses the text as a springboard for existential warnings rather than verse-by-verse exposition.

illocutie.beschrijving: The preacher primarily warns and describes (Assertive/Directive). There is a strong attempt to create urgency through storytelling.
voorbeelden: I believe it is possible for one to refuse the offerings of grace.
The dead, small and great, shall stand before the judgment seat of God.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: Fear of God, urgency to repent, and awareness of the finality of time.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Moderate; the preacher warns against grieving the Spirit but focuses on the human capacity to hear.

voorbeelden: The Bible tells us that there are not only these constant testings...
Pops Swinton was a dapper little man.
Do not let any cloud grow so thick...
Keep an ear tuned for the Lord.
I cringe almost from thinking about it.
I would to God that I could plead with you.
There is a promise here in all of this [vague reference].
Trust him for his grace [imperative-commissive hybrid].
commissieven.kwaliteit: Weak. The 'promise' is described as a future fact rather than a present binding of God to the hearer.

voorbeelden: Today is the day of salvation!
declaratieven.autoriteit: Low. The preacher remains in the role of a witness/warner rather than a mandatory of the keys.

indicatoren: Extensive storytelling about fruitcake and Pops Swinton (narrative constatives).
Theological speculation about the 'exhaustion of mercy' (descriptive constatives).
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer becomes a spectator of stories and a student of a 'possibility' rather than a subject of an act.

missende_elementen: Direct promise of Christ to the hearer
performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: Anxiety. The hearer is told to 'trust' but is not given the specific word of Christ to lean on.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: The preacher speaks *about* the possibility of grace but does not *bestow* it.

tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Mostly used in directives (commands) rather than commissives (promises).

derde_persoon.gebruik: Describing the fruitcake story, Pops Swinton, and the mechanics of judgment.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: High. The sermon feels like a lecture on the 'reality of judgment' rather than a judgment occurring.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: General truths about judgment and mercy.

actueel_present.gebruik: Urging the congregation to listen now.

foutief_patroon.beschrijving: Assertive (Judgment is coming) -> Directive (So you must listen/repent).
voorbeelden: Judgment Day had come... Oh, hear me today! If you are drifting... think very solemnly.
foutief_patroon.probleem: The 'Promise' (Toezegging) is missing as the bridge. The hearer is left with the weight of the law without the performative gift of the Gospel.

voorbeelden_slechte_verhouding: There is to be a judgment... unless you repent you shall all likewise perish.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon relies on psychological appeal and the threat of judgment to move the will, rather than the creative power of the Gospel word.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The whole section on Pops Swinton.
zwakke_punten.probleem: It suggests some people might be beyond help, but offers no performative 'But I say to you' from Christ.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: It is a lecture about a future event, not a present event of grace.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The preacher does not speak 'in the person of Christ' to the hearer.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: God is described as a judge who spoke in the past or will speak in the future.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: The preacher acts more as a witness/observer than a mandatory.
tekstueel_bewijs: I will say that I believe that we can so rebuff the Holy Spirit.

pneumatologie.geest_rol_erkend: Yes, as one who can be grieved.
pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: The preacher takes on the burden of perlocution (trying to 'plead' and 'make' them hear).
tekstueel_bewijs: I would to God that I could plead with you.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: No, it is treated as a warning about a means of grace that might run out.
tekstueel_bewijs: The day will come when there will be no more time for preaching.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: Too many 3rd person past tense verbs; almost no 2nd person present commissives.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: The Bible says... unless you repent you shall all likewise perish.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: On the authority of Christ, I call you now: Turn and live, for His mercy is for you today.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Shifts from a general threat to a specific, addressed call.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The Gospel is a 'possibility' rather than a 'promise'.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Use 'I' and 'You' in the name of Christ.
voorbeeldzinnen: In the name of Jesus, I declare to you: your sins are covered by His blood.

adressering_verbetering.probleem: Too many stories about other people (Pops Swinton, Pilate).
adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Bring the judgment and the cross into the 'Now' of the congregation.
voorbeeldzinnen: You stand before Him now, not just then.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The imperative (repent!) is not fueled by a declarative (you are loved/forgiven).
indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Declare the work of Christ as a finished fact for the hearer before demanding a response.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon has great rhetorical power and narrative grip, but it risks leaving the hearer in a state of 'constative anxiety' rather than 'performative peace'.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' (his earnestness). SAT reveals that despite his earnestness, he fails to perform the act of 'Toezegging' (Promise).
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetorically, the Pops Swinton story is a masterpiece of pathos. Illocutionarily, it is a 'misfire' because it creates a theological category of 'too far gone' without the counter-declarative of the Gospel.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT exposes that the preacher is 'talking about' God's mercy running out rather than 'dispensing' God's mercy while it is still 'Today'.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: Pops Swinton had gone so far that he could not get back.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: Negative; creates a 'constative' barrier to the Gospel.

appendices.notities: The sermon is a classic example of 'Constative Surplus' where the preacher's own earnestness (Expressive) tries to compensate for a lack of sacramental authority (Declarative).
